channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Days of doomscrolling are over. How to find cheer online by bloomscrolling
This Week in Explainers: How Pakistan is set to give army chief Asim Munir greater powers
History Today: How fall of the Berlin Wall shaped modern Germany
Afghanistan-Pakistan peace talks collapse once again. What happens now?
US govt shutdown: How flight cuts are affecting travellers amidst season rush
What is happening in Mali where 5 Indian workers were kidnapped?
How Pakistan’s 27th amendment will turn a ‘failed marshal’ into a dictator
item.description: No wonder PTI leader Imran Khan called Asim Munir the ‘most oppressive dictator in Pakistan’s history’

item.title: Creating a new ‘Mamdania’: Without their narrative, Hindu Americans have no future
item.description: South Asianists have a cultural monopoly now over Indian children in America, and Hindu Americans have failed to invest where investment is needed – education in social sciences, arts, media, culture, and so on

item.title: From global stage to strategic silence: India’s bold diplomacy faces new test in Trump era
item.description: The practice of strategic autonomy and defiance always comes at a cost

item.title: October in Delhi, November in Niagara: How Mark Carney’s premiership brings optimism to India-Canada ties
item.description: Mark Carney’s arrival as Canadian prime minister matters because he is not invested in yesterday’s fights

item.title: How Zohran Mamdani struck a chord with New Yorkers
item.description: Mamdani’s ability to translate youth enthusiasm into structured organisation set him apart

item.title: How Trishul exercise marks India’s shift from ‘Cold Start’ to ‘Cold Strike’ doctrine
item.description: For the broader strategic community, the message from Trishul is unambiguous. India has entered the phase of technological deterrence, where strength is measured not only by numbers or firepower but by integration, speed and autonomy
